intro: Dunbaria crinita, commonly known as the hairy spurflower, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is a member of the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its small, fleshy leaves and clusters of yellow flowers that bloom in spring. It thrives in sandy, well-drained soils and is adapted to arid environments. Dunbaria crinita is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and drought tolerance.
